result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen L. Kees

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant Karen L. Kees in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Karen L. Kees.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Defense requests more time to complete community service.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 02:45 pm.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 10, 2022.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statements
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:16 AM Defendant Karen L. Kees in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date in about 30 days to allow defendant to pay up front restitution.
State advises there is no restitution request but the defendant needs to complete 20 hours of community service to comply with the offer.
Defendant advises she can complete the community service within 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:39 AM Defendant Karen L. Kees in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no intentional contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

08:30 AM Defendant Karen L. Kees in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Hughes is appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
